description: I'm not sure if this software will running with GNOME, but with my installation it's not running with GNOME.

http://lists.x2go.org/pipermail/x2go-dev/2018-February/012420.html

App Indicators are not working in Ubuntu versions based off of Gnome until the maintainer implements support for Ayatana app indicators. In other words this software is completely useless in newer versions of Ubuntu.
summary: Broken in Ubuntu based on Gnome

description:
This app cannot be used anymore and needs to be updated. 
Remmina does it tough, so I wouldn't expect any changes to this app to come.
The icon doesn't appear, so there is no way to use it.
summary: It doesn't work on Ubuntu with GNOME

description:
I installed it from the Ubuntu Software app, then i launched it from the Ubuntu "Show Application" button. A phoca logo appeared in the center of the monitor, then disappeared, then nothing. there is no small pyHoca icon in the toolbar. 
If i do ps aux on a terminal, i see that the pyhoca process is running, but i do not see how to use it.
l'application se lance mais l'applet n'apparait pas, donc impossible a utiliser
ne fonctionne pas . L'application se lance mais la fenetre demeure introuvable.
